holidays.name: Awkward Moments Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to embrace the cringe-worthy, awkward moments that make life funny and memorable. Instead of hiding from embarrassment, celebrate the human experience of clumsy social situations!
holidays.origin: Started as a humorous online trend to lighten the mood around social faux pas.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that sharing awkward moments actually helps people bond and reduces social anxiety.

holidays.name: Sloppy Joe Day
holidays.description: Celebrate your love for the messy, delicious sandwich made with ground beef and a tangy tomato-based sauce stuffed into a bun! It‚Äôs a day to get sauce on your hands and smile while eating.
holidays.origin: Originated in the United States as a regional summertime favorite, gaining national attention in the late 20th century.
holidays.funFact: The 'Sloppy Joe' name may come from a bar owner named Joe who served loose meat sandwiches in the 1930s.

holidays.name: National Biodiesel Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the contributions of Rudolf Diesel, inventor of the diesel engine that eventually ran on biodiesel, a renewable fuel source made from vegetable oils and animal fats.
holidays.origin: Commemorates Rudolf Diesel‚Äôs birthday (March 18, 1858) and promotes awareness of alternative fuels.
holidays.funFact: Biodiesel can reduce greenhouse gas emissions by up to 86% compared to petroleum diesel!

holidays.name: National Sloppy Joe Day
holidays.description: Yes, this messy sandwich gets another shout-out! March 18 honors the Sloppy Joe, celebrating wild sandwich creativity and the joy of deliciously messy food.
holidays.origin: An official food day created to highlight this comfort food favorite.
holidays.funFact: Some restaurants hold 'Sloppy Joe eating contests' on this day ‚Äì prepare to get messy!
